node.title: Scott Morrison may want to 'move on', but leaking Macron’s private texts only ensures French fury will linger
node.alt: A photo of French President Macron, who's wearing a mask, and Scott Morrison with his hand on Macron's shoulder.
node.description: The Prime Minister may have felt justifiably injured after being branded a liar on the world stage, but this was the time for a cool head, not a hot one, writes Andrew Probyn.
node.content:
["Subplots are meant to be subtle, barely seen. They are certainly not supposed to become dominant.", "Scott Morrison's\u00a0reluctant European trip had a subplot. He didn't see it at first. Mind you, no-one else saw it either. \u00a0", "Until it was\u00a0the plot, written by the French President with a much bigger agenda.", "The Prime Minister's trip was always going to be one he\u2019d have to endure, rather than savour. But not for the reasons immediately apparent.", "Morrison had been forced to burnish the Coalition's climate change credentials before leaving Australia: having a commitment for net zero emissions by 2050 was seen as minimum entry for the G20 Summit in Rome and the COP26 climate talks in Glasgow.", "The PM probably anticipated a week-long, grinding defence as to why he wouldn\u2019t commit to a higher 2030 emissions reduction target.", "Then the subplot came steaming unseen under the horizon.", "
Morrison walked into a trap
", "Within an hour or two of the PM's plane touching down in Rome, US President Joe Biden appeared alongside his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron.", "Before the cameras, Biden sympathised with the French President over Australia's handling of a cancelled submarine contract. It had been \"clumsy\"\u00a0and lacking in grace, the President said.", "Biden's candid chat with Macron over the sunken submarine contract wasn't just a public scolding of Australia\u2019s handling of the matter.", "It was a demonstration by the US President that America sees beyond its AUKUS \"forever\"\u00a0friends of Australia and the UK, and that some of its allies are more equal than others.", "Especially a nuclear-armed ally like France which plays a key role in Europe\u2019s foil against Russia and whose strategic and naval presence in the Pacific serves to bolster the US-led regional counter to China.\u00a0", "", "
Joe Biden said Australia had been \"clumsy\" in scrapping the French submarine deal.(AP:\u00a0Evan Vucci)
", "Australian prime ministers have long revelled in the steadfastness of the US friendship, but it's always been an unequal relationship. Donald Trump may be the most recent president to champion the \"America First\"\u00a0attitude, but it has always been there.\u00a0", "And Morrison has discovered that the politeness of Trump's successor only sugars the ruthless self-interest at the heart of the American project.", "Reasserting alignment with a strategic ally in Europe has proven to be more valuable to America than any advantage it may have gained from the toppling of a $90 billion naval contract. \u00a0", "\"Let me be really clear. Australia has made the right decision when it comes to our defence interests in going forward with a nuclear-propelled submarine capability and doing that in partnership with the United States and the United Kingdom,\"\u00a0Morrison told reporters in Rome.\u00a0", "\"Of course, it's a difficult decision. We were very aware that that would lead to some deep disappointment. But you've got to make the right decision for Australia. And that's exactly what we did.\"", "But Biden embarrassed Morrison with his unflattering assessment of the French sub snub, even though (as Australian officials insist) the US was kept fully informed all along.", "Yet the subplot only worsened for Morrison.", "When the ABC intercepted Macron post-press conference on Sunday in Rome, the French President took only a few seconds to decide he would use the opportunity to express what he really thought about the PM.\u00a0", "", "
Emmanuel Macron was intercepted as he walked between meetings, but the French President already knew what he wanted to say.\u00a0(News Video)
", "Indeed, if his nation\u2019s submarines have the speed and pinpoint accuracy with which he targeted Morrison's character, they should be the most feared on the high seas.", "\"Do you think he lied to you?\"\u00a0Macron was asked.", "The subs dispute suddenly took on a venomous personal dimension, worsened by the Morrison camp's crude response \u2014 leaking a text message from Macron to the PM from September.", "If that was a tactical shot across French bows, it was misdirected. It displayed a vindictive and short-term shallowness at a time when Australia needed to show the opposite.", "The PM may have felt deeply injured by Macron's slur \u2014\u00a0perhaps justifiably \u2014\u00a0but this was a time to act in a way that reflected the professed high-minded pursuit of the national interest.", "Morrison didn't see the trap.", "France's bitterness towards the US and Australia after the September sinking of the subs deal began as grand Gallic outrage but over the past six weeks it has become an expert exercise in leverage.", "Macron has a price, and it's up to Morrison to find it", "A distrusting but shrewd Macron now seeks to turn the submarine quarrel into the opening gambit of a bigger power play.\u00a0", "Macron might despise Morrison, but the Australian Prime Minister cannot offer anything in consolation. So for now, at least, Morrison is the subject of his scorn.", "As for France's trans-Atlantic ally, Macron felt deeply betrayed by Biden.", "In 2019, after four years of American strategic retreat under Trump, Macron warned European nations they could no longer rely on America to defend NATO allies.", "\"What we are currently experiencing is the brain death of NATO,\"\u00a0Macron told The Economist.", "Before the dust-up over submarines, Macron had been pushing for a European military force that would operate independently of NATO, as part of a broader vision to establish European strategic autonomy from the US.", "As the New York Times explains it:\u00a0\"This, [Macron]\u00a0argues, should lead the European Union to something like a middle course between two great powers of the 21st century, the United States and China, bound to America through values and long friendship, but engaging rather than confronting China.\"", "The Americans, and many European nations keen on the transatlantic security extended by the US, are anxious that NATO is not undermined.", "So when the French submarine contract was sunk under the gaze of Biden, who had promised to reassert American trustworthiness and global leadership, Macron would have spied opportunity, once his temper cooled.\u00a0", "And it appears Biden is now prepared to give conditional support to a European military force that complements NATO. The US will also offer France counter-terrorism assistance in West Africa.", "The backslapping bonhomie on display between Macron and Biden at G20 has come at an American price dictated by Macron, perhaps explaining in part why Biden might've diplomatically thrown Morrison under the bus. \u00a0", "And what price does Macron have in mind for Morrison, besides derision?\u00a0", "", "
Australia can repair its relationship with France, but a leaked text message has just made doing so more expensive.(AP:\u00a0Rafael Yaghobzadeh)
", "The French President's statement after his prickly telephone call with Morrison shortly before the PM left Canberra for Rome, suggests he hasn't yet got one in mind. And he's set the PM a challenge to find one.", "\"It is now up to the Australian Government to propose tangible actions that embody the political will of Australia\u2019s highest authorities to redefine the basis of our bilateral relationship and continued joint action in the Indo-Pacific,\"\u00a0the statement from the \u00c9lys\u00e9e Palace read.", "It's possible Macron may simply dismiss Morrison as an Australian PM with an American big brother complex.\u00a0", "But after the leak of President Macron's private text message, the price of peace with Paris has grown exponentially."]
